area_name: Rad Rocks and Mystery Stump Areas

content.description: Listed as a project in Bill Cramer’s first edition Prescott Bouldering Guide I sent this line in 2000 or earlier. This is a very cool crimpy line to the right of Mystery Stump. Hard crimps, deadpoints, and a toss to the slopey top. Saw quick repeats by visiting Gunks and Swiss climbers who confirmed the grade. May start off the stump.

Steely Dan is a condition dependent sloper problem to the right of Farmer John. Start with your right hand on the knob and left hand undercling, toe-cam trickery and slapping straight up to the slopers and matching is the game here, wrestle the top out.
content.location: Right of Farmer John, obvious sloping bulge with a big crack on the left.

content.description: Mystery Stump is an Oldschool problem. Start off the old stump if it’s still there. Climb up and left. Seems like a couple campus move to knobs.

Mainline is the perfect rectangular boulder found tucked away towards nail up rock and below the back porch. 

  Mainline starts on the sloping rail down and right, campus, slap and  heel hook your way up the rail and head left. Big moves out to a non-existant slope-crimper that only is alive in the right conditions. Heel Hook and Continue slapping up, lock off and head straight up to the small crimps and top out.
content.protection: Multiple Pads are needed. One for covering a dangerous boulder, and the rest for a flat landing.
content.location: Found below the back porch, way right of Bonnies Problem, on the same trail as Nail Up. Look for the perfect rectangular block.

content.description: Farmer John is a great V4 to throw into your circuit or to project at the grade. It starts on what looks like a right hand undercling, but use it as a gaston and a left hand on a high sloper/crimp. High left foot and flag with the right and you've unlocked it.
content.location: Farmer John is on a boulder behind Bonnies Problem, its located in its own little alcove.

content.description: Classic crimpy knob pulling!  You don't get much, but it is enough.
content.location: Off the Back Porch, look for a boulder with a smooth, vertical face down below.

content.description: The Chronic is a traverse that starts as far down, low and to the right as you can get. Follow the shelf around the corner to the left where you can top out once you hit the crack or continue out, left and up.
content.location: This boulder is located in between the back porch slab and nail up rock. It looks like a big couch (kinda). Right in the heart of the rad rocks area.

pathTokens: Rad Rocks and Mystery Stump Areas

content.description: Rad Rocks is a large cluster of boulders directly below the Back Porch Slab. This area includes The Mystery Stump Boulder.
